summary: Math.{min,max} are recognized as a 0 or 1 argument functions

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Try to compile "Math.{min,max}(1,2)" 2. Use @compilation_level ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS What is the expected output? No warnings. What do you see instead? Warning: JSC_WRONG_ARGUMENT_COUNT: Function Object.min: called with 2 argument(s). Function requires at least 0 argument(s) and no more than 1 argument(s). at line 1 character 8 Math.min(1,2); ^ What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Browser: Opera/9.80 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X; U; en) Presto/2.2.15 Version/10.10 App: http://closure-compiler.appspot.com/home

i think i know the problem. Note that it works in the standalone jar, but not in the 
web service.

Agreed, I experienced this as well from the closure tool hosted at
http://closure-compiler.appspot.com/home.  I was just about to log this bug when I
found this defect.  My code was:
alert( Math.min( 1, 2 ) );

SVN and webservice have now both been update.

Please verify.
